title: install.py Azure Storage AuthenticationFailed

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body: Thanks for all, I have some opinion here. When I run the command `python install.py` 1. Enter 3 to select the Azure Storage. 2. Enter the connect string . 3. Enter the blob name -> Default name (diffgram-stroage). 4. Write to Blob failed, because no blob here -> here is never mind I create the blob by my hands. 5. Read from Blob failed and exception return following: `Exception: Error when accessing presigned URL: Status(403). Error: AuthenticationFailedServer failed to authenticate the request. Make sure the value of Authorization header is formed correctly including the signature. RequestId:1322947c-201e-000d-08d6-938bd2000000 Time:2021-08-18T02:15:58.4441445ZSignature not valid in the specified time frame: Start [Wed, 18 Aug 2021 02:16:01 GMT] - Expiry [Mon, 28 Nov 2022 07:36:01 GMT] - Current [Wed, 18 Aug 2021 02:15:58 GMT]` I write the azure blob before and it work fine. so I check the install.py code at line:145 I saw the code here has `start = datetime.datetime.utcnow(),` this arg, and I check my code was written doesn't have this arg. I annotate this arg and I work perfectly. So maybe no this line `start = datetime.datetime.utcnow(),` more better?
